oai_dc:dc.dc:title: U. S. Model 1860 (aka 1857) cavalry saber
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The saber belonged to Sgt. John B. Lambdin, Co. E, 5th Tenn. Mtd. Inf., USA. It bears a U.S. stamp, a "C. E. W." inspector's mark and the maker's mark of David J. Millard of Clayville, N.Y., who contracted for 10,000 light cavalry swords in December 1861. A mechanic, John Lambdin volunteered at the age of 44 on October 8, 1864 in Cleveland, Tenn. and mustered out in Nashville, Tenn. on July 12, 1865.
